comment.author: 30085166@N00
comment._content: Alton Brooks Parker (1852-1926) was temporary chairman and keynote speaker of the 1912 Democratic Party convention in Baltimore. A long-time jurist in New York, he had been the Democratic candidate for President in 1904. Wikipedia article.

comment.author: 36899742@N00
comment._content: Thomas Riley Marshall was nominated as vice president  on July 2, 1912. He was elected along with Wilson and served as vice president from 1913 to 1921.

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Thank you for the information. Will submit for review and clarification to the catalog record.
